  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="57%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:57.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note
  receivable exchanged for equity investment</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">$</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#151;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">500,000</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">See Notes to Consolidated
Financial Statements.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">38</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='38',FILE='C:\JMS\jpatrow\04-15066-1\task259499\15066-1-ba-02.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Dec 21 13:00 2004' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">TODHUNTER INTERNATIONAL, INC. AND
SUBSIDIARIES</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><a name="NotesToConsolidatedFinancialStatemen"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to Consolidated
Financial Statements</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 1.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Nature
of Business and Significant Accounting Policies</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Nature of business</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Todhunter
International, Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;), is a leading producer and supplier of rum,
brandy, wine and spirits to other beverage alcohol manufacturers; produces,
imports and markets premium branded spirits; bottles beverage alcohol and other
beverages on a contract basis and under its own labels; and produces vinegar and
cooking wine.&#160; The Company operates four
production facilities in the United States and one in St. Croix, United States
Virgin Islands and purchases certain products for resale.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Ownership</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; Angostura Limited (&#147;Angostura&#148;), a
Trinidad-based distiller, beneficially owns shares, representing approximately
68% of the Company&#146;s common stock.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A
summary of the Company&#146;s significant accounting policies follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Principles
of consolidation</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The consolidated financial statements include
the accounts of Todhunter International, Inc. and all of its majority-owned
subsidiaries.&#160; All significant
intercompany balances and transactions have been eliminated in
consolidation.&#160; Investments in business
entities in which the Company does not have control, but has the ability to
exercise significant influence over operating and financial policies (generally
20-50% ownership), are accounted for by the equity method.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Accounting
estimates</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The preparation of financial statements
requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported
amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and
liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of
revenues and expenses during the reporting period.&#160; Actual results could differ from those
estimates.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Revenue
recognition</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The Company recognizes revenue when its
product is shipped, at which time title passes to the customer.&#160; Revenues from contract bottling services are
recognized at the time the bottling process is completed.&#160; Excise taxes on products sold are billed
directly to customers and are included in sales at the same time the product
sold is recognized as revenue.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cash
equivalents</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The Company considers certificates of deposit
and other short-term investments with an original maturity of three months or
less to be cash equivalents.&#160; The Company
maintains depository accounts in excess of FDIC insured limits.&#160; The Company has not experienced any credit
losses in such accounts and does not anticipate any losses.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Functional
currency</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The functional currency for all foreign
subsidiaries is the U.S dollar.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Short-term
investments</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The Company has investments in certificates
of deposit and commercial paper, which mature within one year of purchase.&#160; All of the Company&#146;s short-term investments
are classified as held-to-maturity and are carried at amortized cost.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Trade
receivables</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The Company records trade receivables at
cost, which approximates fair value at the respective balance sheet dates.&#160; The Company estimates its allowance for
doubtful accounts based on a combination of historical and current information
regarding the balance of trade receivables, as well as the current composition
of the pool of trade receivables.&#160; The
Company determines status on trade receivables based on the contractual terms
of the original sale.&#160; Trade receivables
that management believes to be uncollectible are written off upon such
determination.&#160; Recoveries of accounts
receivable previously written off are recorded when received.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">39</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='39',FILE='C:\JMS\jpatrow\04-15066-1\task259499\15066-1-ba-02.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Dec 21 13:00 2004' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Inventories</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; Inventories are stated at the lower of cost
or market.&#160; Cost is determined using the
first-in, first-out method.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Property
and equipment</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; Property and equipment is stated at
cost.&#160; Depreciation is calculated on the
straight-line method over the estimated useful lives of the various classes of
depreciable assets.&#160; Estimated lives are
as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="93%" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:.15in;width:93.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="85%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:85.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Years</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="85%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:85.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Land
  improvements</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3 - 20</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="85%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:85.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Buildings
  and improvements</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3 - 40</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="85%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:85.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Machinery
  and equipment</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3 - 33</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Trademarks</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; Amortization on trademarks held are computed
on the straight-line basis over the estimated lives of the trademarks.&#160; Estimated lives are three to forty years (see
Note 7).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Deferred
loan costs</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; Deferred loan costs included in interest
expense are computed using the effective interest method over the term of the
loan (see Note 7).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Impairment
of long-lived assets</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; As of October&nbsp;1, 2001, the Company
adopted Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 144, (&#147;SFAS 144&#148;), <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for the Impairment or Disposal of
Long-Lived Assets</font></i>.&#160; Long-lived
assets held for use are subject to an impairment assessment if the carrying
value is no longer recoverable based upon the undiscounted future cash flows of
the asset or fair value less costs to sell.&#160;
The amount of impairment is the difference between the carrying amount
and the fair value of the related asset.&#160;
The Company&#146;s estimate of undiscounted cash flows or fair value less
costs to sell indicated that such carrying amounts were expected to be
recovered.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Income
taxes</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; Deferred income tax assets and liabilities
are computed for differences between the financial statement and tax bases of
assets and liabilities that will result in taxable or deductible amounts in the
future based on enacted tax laws and rates applicable to the periods in which
the differences are expected to affect taxable income.&#160; Valuation allowances are established when
necessary to reduce deferred tax assets to the amount expected to be realized.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Preferred
stock</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The Company has authorized 2,500,000 shares
of $.01 par value preferred stock.&#160; No
terms are stated as to dividend, liquidation or other rights applicable to
these shares.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">40</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='40',FILE='C:\JMS\jpatrow\04-15066-1\task259499\15066-1-ba-02.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Dec 21 13:00 2004' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stock
options</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The Company applies Accounting Principles
Board Opinion Number 25, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for
Stock Issued to Employees</font></i> (&#147;APB 25&#148;) and related interpretations in
accounting for options granted, which requires compensation expense for the
Company&#146;s options to be recognized only if the market price of the underlying
stock exceeds the exercise price on the date of grant.&#160; Accordingly, the Company has not recognized
compensation expense for its options granted after 1994.&#160; SFAS 123, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting
for Stock-Based Compensation</font></i>, issued in October&nbsp;1995, requires
pro forma disclosures for option grants made after December&nbsp;31, 1994, when
accounting for stock-based compensation plans in accordance with APB 25.&#160; As of January&nbsp;1, 2003, the Company
adopted SFAS 148, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for Stock-Based
Compensation-Transition and Disclosure</font></i>, an amendment of SFAS 123.
The standard amends SFAS 123 to provide alternative methods of transition for
voluntary changes to the fair value based method of accounting for stock-based
employee compensation. Additionally, SFAS 148 amends the disclosure
requirements of SFAS 123 to require pro-forma disclosures when the intrinsic
value method continues to be used.&#160; The
Company has elected to continue accounting for stock-based compensation using
the intrinsic method in accordance with APB 25, and has adopted the new
disclosure requirements specified under SFAS 148.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If
the Company had elected to recognize compensation cost based on the fair value
of the options granted at grant date as prescribed by SFAS No. 123, net income
(loss) and earnings (loss) per common share would have been reduced to the pro
forma amounts shown below:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">)</font></b></p>
  </td>

</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
pro forma effects are determined as if compensation costs were recognized using
the fair value based accounting method.&#160;
The fair values of options granted during 1999 and 1998 were estimated
on the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option pricing model with the
following assumptions:&#160; risk free
interest rate of 4.75% and 4.75%; expected lives of 10 years; expected
volatility of 29% and 30%; and a zero percent dividend yield.&#160; The weighted-average fair value of options
granted during 1999 and 1998 was $3.98 and $4.67, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">41</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='41',FILE='C:\JMS\jpatrow\04-15066-1\task259499\15066-1-ba-02.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Dec 21 13:00 2004' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Intangible
assets</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; As of October&nbsp;1, 2001, the Company
adopted SFAS 142, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Goodwill and Other
Intangible Assets</font></i>.&#160; SFAS 142
supercedes APB Opinion No. 17, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Intangible
Assets</font></i>, and requires goodwill and other intangible assets that have
an indefinite useful life to no longer be amortized; however, these assets must
be reviewed at least annually for impairment.&#160;
As required by SFAS 142, the Company has completed the goodwill
impairment test and has concluded that there was no impairment to goodwill as
of and for the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2004 and 2003.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Advertising
costs</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; Advertising costs are charged to expense as
incurred.&#160; Advertising costs were
$2,841,768, $589,648, and $1,017,632 for the years ended September&nbsp;30,
2004, 2003, and 2002, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Reclassifications</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; Certain amounts in the 2003 and 2002
consolidated financial statements have been reclassified to conform with the
2004 presentation with no effect on net income (loss) or stockholders&#146; equity.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 2.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Inventories</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
major components of inventories as of September&nbsp;30, 2004 and 2003 are:</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 4.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes
Receivable From Affiliates</font></p>

receivable from affiliates consist of the following as of September&nbsp;30,
2004 and 2003:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 5.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Trade
Credits</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company entered into an agreement with a corporate trading company
to receive trade credits upon installment deliveries of ready-to-drink
beverages (&#147;products&#148;) from buyers obtained by the corporate trading
company.&#160; The Company has $500,000 and
$1,086,271 as of September&nbsp;30, 2004 and 2003, respectively, included in
other current assets on the accompanying consolidated balance sheets.&#160; Additionally, the Company has $1,176,809 and
$0 as of September&nbsp;30, 2004 and 2003, respectively, included in other
assets, on the accompanying consolidated balance sheets.&#160; Earned trade credits must be utilized by June&nbsp;30,
2008 and are subject to terms as more specifically defined in the agreement.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">43</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 7.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Trademarks
and Deferred Loan Costs</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Trademarks
and deferred loan costs consist of the following as of September&nbsp;30, 2004
and 2003:</font></p>

  </td>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">1,400,999</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Amortization
charged to trademarks for each of the three years in the period ended September&nbsp;30,
2004 were $40,200.&#160; Amounts charged to
interest expense for deferred loan costs were $308,904, $299,004 and $315,000,
for the fiscal years ended 2004, 2003 and 2002, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">44</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>

 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="70%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:70.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">$</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.82%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">4,726,253</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.42%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3,837,745</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 9.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Financing
Arrangements</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Long-term
debt consists of the following as of September&nbsp;30, 2004 and 2003:</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">47,315,617</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .65in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(i)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In October&nbsp;2001, the Company entered
into a $70 million credit agreement, consisting of a $40 million term loan and
a $30 million revolving loan facility.&#160;
During March&nbsp;2004, the credit agreement was amended to reduce the
revolving loan facility to $15 million.&#160;
In June&nbsp;2004, the credit agreement was modified to extend the
maturity date of the revolving loans to be the same as the term loans, September&nbsp;2006.&#160; The credit agreement is collateralized
principally by all assets located in the United States of America.&#160; Under this credit agreement, the Company has
certain limitations in its ability to pay dividends to stockholders.&#160; Also, the Company is required to maintain certain
financial covenants under the credit agreement.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .65in;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December&nbsp;20,
2004, the Company received a waiver of its financial covenants compliance
requirement for the quarter ended September&nbsp;30, 2004.&#160; The financial covenant requirements were also
amended prospectively in accordance with the Company&#146;s business plan for the
following fiscal year.&#160; The Company
agreed to a .25% increase from its current interest rates so long as the Funded
Debt to EBITDA ratio is between 2.50 and 3.25.&#160;
In addition, if the Company&#146;s Funded Debt to EBITDA ratio is between
3.26 and 4.00, the interest rate would be .25% higher than the rate for the
2.50 to 3.25 level.&#160; The maturity date of
the credit agreement was modified to January&nbsp;31, 2006, and the Company
paid an amendment fee of $107,500.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .65in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(ii)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition to the quarterly principal
payments, the Company may be required to make additional principal payments
based on results of the Company&#146;s domestic operating profits as defined in the
agreement.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">46</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 10.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Income

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Temporary
differences between the financial statement carrying amounts and tax bases of
assets and liabilities that give rise to significant portions of the deferred
tax assets and liabilities relate to the following as of September&nbsp;30,
2004 and 2003:</font></p>

deferred tax amounts mentioned above have been classified on the accompanying

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">$</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(333,000</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">)</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3,019,000</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">No valuation allowance has been recorded as of September&nbsp;30, 2004
or 2003.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">48</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

tax expense (benefits) differed from the amounts computed by applying the
statutory federal income tax rate to income before income taxes as a result of
the following for the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2004, 2003 and 2002:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Generally,
the operating income of the Company&#146;s Bahamian subsidiary is not subject to
United States income taxes and there are no income taxes in the Commonwealth of
the Bahamas.&#160; Certain passive income of
the Bahamian subsidiary is subject to United States income taxes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Virgin Islands subsidiary, through the Industrial Development Commission of the
Government of the Virgin Islands of the United States, has received a 90%
exemption from income taxes on operating income.&#160; This exemption is effective through September&nbsp;2020.&#160; The per share effect of this exemption on
earnings on a basic and diluted basis for the years ended September&nbsp;30,
2004, 2003 and 2002, respectively, is as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">With
respect to the Company&#146;s foreign subsidiaries, no provision has been made for
taxes, which would result from the remittance of such undistributed earnings as
the Company intends to reinvest these earnings indefinitely.&#160; The Company&#146;s aggregate share of
undistributed earnings of its foreign subsidiaries was approximately $43.7
million and $38.9 million as of September&nbsp;30, 2004 and 2003, respectively.&#160; The undistributed earnings of the Company&#146;s
foreign subsidiaries have been reduced by any previously taxed income.</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">49</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 11.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Commitments</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Leases</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The Company occupies office space under
noncancelable operating leases which expire through December&nbsp;2006.&#160; One of the leases contains two renewal
options of five years each.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Future
minimum lease payments under these noncancelable operating leases as of September&nbsp;30,
2004 are as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Rent
expense for office space (including the Company&#146;s share of common area
expenses, real estate and sales taxes) amounted to $503,519, $484,782 and
$485,206 for the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2004, 2003 and 2002,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Event
Sponsorship</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; In 2004, the Company entered into a
noncancelable agreement with an entertainer to promote one of the Company&#146;s
trademarked products.&#160; The agreement
covers the calendar years 2005 through 2007 with total fees amounting to
$4,271,745.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 12.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stock
Options</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On
August&nbsp;11, 1992, the Company adopted a stock option plan for the grant of
options to key employees.&#160; Option prices
may not be less than 85% of the fair market value of the Company&#146;s common stock
on the date of grant for nonqualified options or 100% of such fair market value
for qualified stock options.&#160; Options
granted have vesting periods ranging from 3 to 5 years.&#160; The Company received a total of $300,625,
$139,125 and $339,000 upon the exercise of stock options for 37,000, 17,000 and
56,500 shares for the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2004, 2003 and 2002,
respectively.&#160; This plan has expired and
no new options can be granted in the future from this plan.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On
March&nbsp;16, 2004, the Company adopted a stock option plan for the grant of
options to key employees. The terms of this plan are substantially similar to
the plan adopted in 1992.&#160; There are
853,000 common shares reserved for issuance under this plan.&#160; No options have been granted under this plan.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">50</font></p>

following table summarizes information about the stock options at September&nbsp;30,
2004:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="57%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:57.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Number</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">

exercise price of options at grant date has been made at fair value.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 13.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Segment
and Geographic Information</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company operates primarily in the beverage alcohol industry in the United
States.&#160; The Company reports its
operating results in four segments:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Bulk
Alcohol Products (rum, citrus brandy, citrus spirits, cane spirits, fortified
citrus wine, purchased distilled products and byproducts)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Premium
Branded Spirits (primarily Cruzan Estate Rums and Cruzan Flavored Rums)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Bottling
Operations (contract bottling services and proprietary and private label
products)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Vinegar
and Cooking Wine (bulk vinegar, bulk cooking wine, vinegar stock and
proprietary and private label case goods)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Corporate
Operations (includes certain expenses of the Company&#146;s executive offices that
are not allocated to the operating segments described above)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
accounting policies of the reportable segments are the same as those described
in Note 1 to the Consolidated Financial Statements.&#160; The Company evaluates the performance of its
operating segments based on income before income taxes, equity in income
(losses) of equity investee, interest income and expense. Material intersegment
sales and transfers have been eliminated.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">52</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:11.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='52',FILE='C:\JMS\jpatrow\04-15066-1\task259499\15066-1-ba-03.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Dec 21 13:05 2004' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net
sales, operating income (loss), identifiable assets, depreciation and
amortization, capital expenditures and goodwill for the Company&#146;s operating
segments for the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2004, 2003 and 2002 are as
follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="57%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:57.0%;">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='53',FILE='C:\JMS\jpatrow\04-15066-1\task259499\15066-1-ba-03.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Dec 21 13:05 2004' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sales
and operating income for the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2004, 2003, and
2002 and identifiable assets as of the end of each period classified by
geographic area, were as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="57%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:57.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">United States</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">U. S. Virgin<br>
  Islands and<br>
  the Bahamas</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Consolidated</font></b></p>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Included
in net sales for the United States are export sales, primarily to Eastern
Europe, Canada and the Caribbean, totaling approximately $8,000,000, $6,300,000
and $6,400,000 for the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2004, 2003 and 2002,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 14.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Defined
Contribution Retirement Plan</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company has a defined contribution retirement plan which covers substantially
all United States employees.&#160; Generally,
employer contributions to the plan begin to vest to the benefit of the
participant after three years of service.&#160;
Participants are immediately vested in any elective contributions and
related earnings, if any.&#160; Participants
are entitled, upon retirement, to their vested portion of the retirement fund
assets.&#160; The Company contributed
$1,206,986, $967,962 and $1,043,311 to the plan for the years ended September&nbsp;30,
2004, 2003 and 2002, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">54</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:11.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='54',FILE='C:\JMS\jpatrow\04-15066-1\task259499\15066-1-ba-03.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Dec 21 13:05 2004' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 15.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Supplemental
Executive Retirement Plan</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During
2004, the Company&#146;s Compensation and Stock Option Committee approved a
supplemental executive retirement plan for certain key executives of the
Company.&#160; The plan is an unfunded plan
within the meaning of Financial Accounting Standard 132.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
obligations and funded status as of September&nbsp;30, 2004 are:</font></p>

  <td width="15" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="80" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 16.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Investment
in Premier Wines &amp; Spirits, Ltd.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
1997, the Company acquired a 45% interest in Premier Wines &amp; Spirits, Ltd.,
(&#147;Premier&#148;), a wholesale liquor distributor in the United States Virgin
Islands, for $450,000.&#160; This investment
is being accounted for using the equity method.&#160;
The Company had sales to Premier of approximately $2,099,000, $2,345,000
and $2,008,000 for the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2004, 2003 and 2002,
respectively.&#160; Included in trade
receivables is approximately $668,000 and $343,000 as of September&nbsp;30, 2004
and 2003, respectively, related to these sales.&#160;
The Company had outstanding advances to Premier of $787,019 as of September&nbsp;30,
2004 and 2003, which are included in investments in and advances to equity
investees.&#160; These advances are unsecured
and bear interest at 6.0%.&#160; Interest
payments are due monthly or on demand in accordance with the terms of the
agreement.&#160; Principal is payable on
demand.&#160; Included in the Company&#146;s
retained earnings are undistributed earnings of Premier of $1,661,322 and
$1,308,660 as of September&nbsp;30, 2004 and 2003, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 17.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fair
Value of Financial Instruments</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following methods and assumptions were used to estimate the fair value of each
class of financial instruments for which it is practicable to estimate that
value:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
carrying amounts approximate fair values as of September&nbsp;30, 2004 and 2003
for cash and cash equivalents, short-term investments, trade receivables, other
receivables and accounts payable because of the short-term maturities of those
instruments.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes
receivable</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The fair value of the Company&#146;s notes
receivable has been determined based on available market information and
management&#146;s estimate of current market conditions of similar instruments.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">56</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='56',FILE='C:\JMS\jpatrow\04-15066-1\task259499\15066-1-ba-03.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Dec 21 13:05 2004' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Long-term
debt</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The fair value of the Company&#146;s long-term
debt is estimated based on the current rates offered to the Company for debt of
the same remaining maturities with similar collateral requirements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr height="0">
  <td width="317" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="92" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="8" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="94" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="8" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="75" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="94" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="3" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 18.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net
Income (Loss) Per Common Share</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Basic
net income (loss) per common share is computed using the weighted average
number of common shares outstanding during the period.&#160; Diluted net income (loss) per share is
computed using the weighted average number of common and dilutive common
equivalent shares outstanding during the period.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.99</font></p>

  </td>

</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
effect of stock options have not been included for the year ended September&nbsp;30,
2004, as their effect would have been anti-dilutive.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">57</font></p>

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

  </td>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
